intro: Diplospora andamanica, commonly known as the Andaman diplospora, is a flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
